results.title: Introduction
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Shows the three sections of a band - the brasses, the woodwinds, and the percussions - and explains the function of each group of instruments. Explains that the addition of a string section distinguishes an orchestra from a band. Includes demonstrations of well-known instruments from each section. Features the Jollet Township High School Band and the Youth Orchestra of Greater Chicago.

results.title: Introduction
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Introduces some main features of hospital food organisation: varied deparments, their equipment, and the over-all system of menu planning. Shows the general arrangements of food preparation used in hospitals.

results.title: Introducingt 2C,L: a language for numerically controlled tools
results.brief_description: Brings attention to the changing look of specialisation in machinery and how computer technology affects it. In doing so, we see that skills must be relocated so that single production becomes multiple production. Here, 2CL is a computer language that operators must learn which control machinery movement. The language is everyday English that is contracted to six letters, eg “diamet” for diameter.

results.title: Introducing the new worker to his job
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Caraval Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
A new worker is being started in his job; his induction is done poorly, and the worker shows considerable dissatisfaction with his treatment. A demonstration of how a worker should be introduced to his new job is then given.

results.title: Introducing the new worker
results.creator_credit: Public Relations Films, Central Office of Information and Richard Massingham
results.brief_description: A film showing the importance of a thorough introduction being given to the new worker on their arrival at a factory, so that they understand the practical routine and can settle down satisfactorily. Correct and incorrect methods of induction are illustrated.

results.title: Introducing the map
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and S.G. Fergusson
results.brief_description: Shows how the rudiments of map reading may be learned through a simple study of local geography. Two children arrive in the country and engage in an exploring game. Three flags placed in different parts of the village are marked on a map; each flag to be found with the assistance of the map and an aerial photograph. The instructional approach throughout the film is indirect and simple.

results.title: Introducing the Eucalypts
results.creator_credit: Paul Broady and Video Education Australia
results.brief_description: This program covers the main features of our Eucalypts: their identifying characteristics (especially the bark, flower buds and leaves), adaptability, distribution patterns, growth and type of timber produced, and their human and non-human uses.

results.title: Introducing the atom
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Atoms for Peace”.
An overall introduction to the series. Provides a basic explanation of atomic energy. Animated sequences demonstrate the make-up, function, formation and controlled chain reaction. It shows the atomic pile at Los Alamos and the preparation and storage of radio-isotopes at Oak Ridge. Touches on the uses of atomic materials in medical research, agriculture and industry. The film ends with excerpts from President Eisenhower’s speech before the United Nations, emphasising America’s hopes and desires for International control of atomic energy dedicated to human welfare everywhere.
